```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(flexdashboard)
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
#read in the data (longer, one row per season)
ratings <- read_csv("../data/IMDb_Economist_tv_ratings.csv")
head(ratings)
```

```{r}
#make a wider version of the data (one row per show)
wide_ratings <- ratings %>% pivot_wider(id_cols = c(title, genres),
                        names_from = seasonNumber,
                        names_prefix = "season_",
                        names_sort = TRUE,
                        values_from = av_rating,
                        values_fill = NA) %>% 
                unnest(cols = season_1:season_44)
head(wide_ratings)
```

### Chart A

```{r}
#Casey

summary <- ratings %>%
  group_by(title) %>%
  summarize(overall_rat = mean(av_rating),
            num_seasons = max(seasonNumber)) %>% 
  mutate(renewed = num_seasons > 1)

summary %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=num_seasons, y=overall_rat)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x="Number of Seasons",
       y = "Overall Rating") +
  geom_smooth(method="lm")

#does the show's overall rating predict whether the number of seasons it'll have?
summ_lm <- lm(num_seasons ~ overall_rat, data=summary)
summary(summ_lm)
#no

#does the show's overall rating predict whether it will be renewed?
renewal_lm <- lm(renewed ~ overall_rat, summary)
summary(renewal_lm)
#yes


ratings %>% group_by(title) %>% mutate(renewed = max(seasonNumber > 1)) %>% 
  filter(seasonNumber == 1) %>% 
  summarize(renewed = renewed,
            season1rat = av_rating)
```
